<!-- Extensions --> <extension> <!-- 0..* Context: Resource = Questionnaire --> <url value="http://hl7.org/fhir/Profile/questionnaire-sdc#additionalTitle"/> <!-- Extensions: #additionalTitle.value, #additionalTitle.context --> </extension>
<extension> <!-- 1..1 Context: Extension = http://hl7.org/fhir/Profile/questionnaire-sdc#additionalTitle --> <url value="http://hl7.org/fhir/Profile/questionnaire-sdc#additionalTitle.value"/> <valueString value="[string]"/><!-- Text for title --> </extension>
<extension> <!-- 1..1 Context: Extension = http://hl7.org/fhir/Profile/questionnaire-sdc#additionalTitle --> <url value="http://hl7.org/fhir/Profile/questionnaire-sdc#additionalTitle.context"/> <valueCodeableConcept><!-- 0..1 CodeableConcept Kind of title --> </valueCodeableConcept> </extension>
<extension> <!-- 0..* Context: Resource = Questionnaire --> <url value="http://hl7.org/fhir/Profile/questionnaire-sdc#additionalQuestionnaireDescription"/> <!-- Extensions: #additionalQuestionnaireDescription.value, #additionalQuestionnaireDescription.context --> </extension>
<extension> <!-- 1..1 Context: Extension = http://hl7.org/fhir/Profile/questionnaire-sdc#additionalQuestionnaireDescription --> <url value="http://hl7.org/fhir/Profile/questionnaire-sdc#additionalQuestionnaireDescription.value"/> <valueString value="[string]"/><!-- Text for description --> </extension>
<extension> <!-- 1..1 Context: Extension = http://hl7.org/fhir/Profile/questionnaire-sdc#additionalQuestionnaireDescription --> <url value="http://hl7.org/fhir/Profile/questionnaire-sdc#additionalQuestionnaireDescription.context"/> <valueCodeableConcept><!-- 0..1 CodeableConcept Kind of description --> </valueCodeableConcept> </extension>
<extension> <!-- 0..1 Context: Resource = Questionnaire --> <url value="http://hl7.org/fhir/Profile/questionnaire-sdc#securityPrivacy"/> <valueString value="[string]"/><!-- Privacy & security guidance --> </extension>
<extension> <!-- 0..* Context: Resource = Questionnaire --> <url value="http://hl7.org/fhir/Profile/questionnaire-sdc#endpoint"/> <valueUrl value="[url]"/><!-- Where to send answers --> </extension>
<extension> <!-- 0..1 Context: Resource = Questionnaire.group --> <url value="http://hl7.org/fhir/Profile/questionnaire-sdc#specialGroup"/> <valueCode value="[code]"/><!-- header | footer --> </extension>
<extension> <!-- 0..* Context: Resource = Questionnaire.group --> <url value="http://hl7.org/fhir/Profile/questionnaire-sdc#additionalGroupText"/> <!-- Extensions: #additionalGroupText.value, #additionalGroupText.type --> </extension>
<extension> <!-- 1..1 Context: Extension = http://hl7.org/fhir/Profile/questionnaire-sdc#additionalGroupText --> <url value="http://hl7.org/fhir/Profile/questionnaire-sdc#additionalGroupText.value"/> <valueString value="[string]"/><!-- Text for display --> </extension>
<extension> <!-- 1..1 Context: Extension = http://hl7.org/fhir/Profile/questionnaire-sdc#additionalGroupText --> <url value="http://hl7.org/fhir/Profile/questionnaire-sdc#additionalGroupText.type"/> <valueCodeableConcept><!-- 0..1 CodeableConcept Kind of text for display --> </valueCodeableConcept> </extension>
<extension> <!-- 0..* Context: Resource = Questionnaire.group.question --> <url value="http://hl7.org/fhir/Profile/questionnaire-sdc#additionalQuestionText"/> <!-- Extensions: #additionalQuestionText.value, #additionalQuestionText.type --> </extension>

publisher.value: U.S. Office of the National Coordinator (ONC)

description.value: Defines how form is used to reflect form definitions to be used within the ONC's Structured Data Capture standard.

formal.value: A structured set of questions.
Additional Content defined by implementations.

comments.value: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

formal.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

short.value: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation

formal.value: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

comments.value: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative.

formal.value: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.

comments.value: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again.

short.value: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation

Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

comments.value: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative.

formal.value: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.

formal.value: External Ids for this questionnaire.

short.value: Logical id for this version of Questionnaire

formal.value: Logical id for this version of Questionnaire.
draft | published | retired.
Identifies when this version of the form was created. Changes whenever the form is updated.
Organization who designed the questionnaire.
Grouped questions.

comments.value: The Questionnaire itself has one "root" group with the actual contents of the Questionnaire. Inquestionnaireation on this root group applies to the questionnaire as a whole.

short.value: To link questionnaire with questionnaire answers

formal.value: To link questionnaire with questionnaire answers.

comments.value: May be omitted if there is no expectation to link answers back to a questionnaire.

short.value: Name to be displayed for group

comments.value: The title of the "root" group is the title for the questionnaire.

short.value: Concept that represents this section on a questionnaire

formal.value: Concept that represents this section on a questionnaire.

comments.value: The code(s) for the "root" group apply to the questionnaire as a whole.

description.value: Codes for questionnaires and groupings of questionnaire questions

formal.value: Additional text for the group.

short.value: Must group be included in data results?

formal.value: Must group be included in data results?.
Whether the group may repeat.

comments.value: When repeats is not given, false is assumed.

formal.value: Grouped questions.

comments.value: The Questionnaire itself has one "root" group with the actual contents of the Questionnaire. Inquestionnaireation on this root group applies to the questionnaire as a whole.

formal.value: Questions in this group.

The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

formal.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

comments.value: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

formal.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

short.value: To link questionnaire with questionnaire answers

formal.value: A unique identifiers within the questionnaire allowing linkage to the equivalent group in a QuestionnaireData resource.

comments.value: May be omitted if there is no expectation to link answers back to a questionnaire.

short.value: Concept that represents this section on a questionnaire

formal.value: Identifies a how this group of questions is known in a particular terminology such as LOINC.

short.value: Text of the question as it is shown to the user

formal.value: Text of the question as it is shown to the user.
The expected format of the answer, e.g. the type of input (string, integer) or whether a (multiple)choice is expected.

comments.value: Additional constraints on the type of answer can be conveyed by extensions.

description.value: The expected format of an answer

short.value: Must group be included in data results?

formal.value: If true, indicates that the group must be present and have required questions within it answered. If false, the group may be skipped when answering the questionnaire.
Whether the group may occur multiple times in the instance, containing multiple sets of answers.

comments.value: When repeats is not given, false is assumed.

formal.value: Reference to a valueset containing the possible options.
Nested group, containing nested question for this question. The order of groups within the question is relevant.

May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

short.value: To link questionnaire with questionnaire answers

formal.value: To link questionnaire with questionnaire answers.

comments.value: May be omitted if there is no expectation to link answers back to a questionnaire.

short.value: Concept that represents this section on a questionnaire

formal.value: Concept that represents this section on a questionnaire.

short.value: Text of the question as it is shown to the user

formal.value: Text of the question as it is shown to the user.
decimal | integer | boolean | date | string +.

comments.value: Additional constraints on the type of answer can be conveyed by extensions.

description.value: The expected format of an answer

short.value: Must group be included in data results?

formal.value: Must group be included in data results?.
Whether the group may repeat.

comments.value: When repeats is not given, false is assumed.

formal.value: Valueset containing the possible options.
Grouped questions.

comments.value: The Questionnaire itself has one "root" group with the actual contents of the Questionnaire. Inquestionnaireation on this root group applies to the questionnaire as a whole.

formal.value: An additional title by which the questionnaire is known or should be represented, including what type of additional title it is.
The title text to display.
Categorizes the type of alternate title. E.g. "Formal", "Scientific", "Previously Known as".

description.value: Categorizes the type of alternate title. E.g. "Formal", "Scientific", "Previously Known as"

formal.value: An additional description explaining the appropriate use of the questionnaire, including what type of additional description it is.
The description text to display.
Categorizes the type of additional questionnaire description. E.g. "Formal", "Scientific".

description.value: Categorizes the type of additional questionnaire description. E.g. "Formal", "Scientific"

formal.value: Provides rules governing the use of this questionnaire from a privacy and/or security perspective. E.g. "confidential when completed".

comments.value: Omission of this extensions doesn't indicate a lack of security or privacy considerations. They may be reflected in the description or might be implicit in context or workflow.

formal.value: The base URL for the server to which questionnaire answers associated with this questionnaire should be submitted.

comments.value: Indicates that the form has been designed with an expectation that it will be submitted to the specified URI. If multiple endpoints are specified, expectation is that answers are submitted to all endpoints.

formal.value: If specified, indicates that the group should be rendered as a repeating header or footer on each "page" of the questionnaire.

comments.value: When omitted, sections are presumed to be "regular" sections.

description.value: If specified, indicates that the group should be rendered as a repeating header or footer on each "page" of the questionnaire.

display.value: Extra text to display for group

short.value: Extra text to display for group

formal.value: Additional text to display at the group level along with guidance as to what sort of text it is.
The additional text to display.
Categorizes the type of additional group text. E.g. "Tool tip", "Help", "Trailing text", etc.

comments.value: The type of text may provide guidance for how/when to display the information.

description.value: Categorizes the type of additional group text. E.g. "Tool tip", "Help", "Trailing text", etc.

display.value: Extra text to display for question

short.value: Extra text to display for question

formal.value: Additional text to display for the question along with guidance as to what sort of text it is.
The additional text to display.
Categorizes the type of additional group text. E.g. "Tool tip", "Help", "Trailing text", "Units" etc.

comments.value: The type of text may provide guidance for how/when to display the information.

description.value: Categorizes the type of additional group text. E.g. "Tool tip", "Help", "Trailing text", "Units" etc.
